intro: Emerus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered emerus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and slightly hairy, with a serrated edge. Emerus grandiflorus is often found in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and along stream banks.
